title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act titled "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" is cited as the official name. It amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 are outlined. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 under the Agreement between the United States and Palau include amounts to be provided in fiscal year 2013, as well as a fiscal consolidation fund with adjustments for fiscal years 2011 and 2012. The United States will provide funding for infrastructure projects in fiscal years 2012 through 2017 under the Agreement with Palau. Congress consents to amendments to the Compact subsidiary agreements, and related laws will be applied with a substitution of dates. Congress consents to amendments to the Compact subsidiary agreements and related laws will be applied with a substitution of dates. Authorization of appropriations for postal services related to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands is provided for fiscal years 2012 through 2024. The Department of the Interior may transfer funds to the United States Postal Service for mail to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. Appropriations for Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association may continue through fiscal year 2024. The successors to Federal entities with appropriations through fiscal year 2011 may receive funding until 2024 for specified purposes. Full faith and credit apply to commitments under the Compact Review Agreement, with oversight and reporting to Congressional committees. The Congress finds that the Government of Palau is eligible for certain US domestic programs. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources and the House Committee on Foreign Affairs by March 1 each year regarding financial assistance under the Compact. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to Congress by March 1 on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. The report should include consultation with relevant Federal agencies. The Secretary of the Interior must consult with relevant Federal agencies when preparing an annual report to Congress on financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeal of prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and limitation on use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. SEC. 136. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. None of the funds for global health activities from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 can be used for assistance to China. The total amount for global health activities is reduced by $2,000,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. ``(a) Limitation.--Funds for climate change activities from 2012 to 2024 cannot be used for assistance to China. The total amount for these activities is reduced by $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. (d) Prohibition on Funding for Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) Program.--Funds for fiscal years 2012 and beyond cannot be used for the DIV Program.'' The Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) Program funding is prohibited for fiscal years 2012 and 2013 by the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The total amount available for the United States Agency for International Development is reduced by $28,200,000. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted after this provision. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 limits funds for the Development Innovation Ventures Program for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. The total amount available for the Agency for International Development is reduced by $28,200,000, regardless of any other laws enacted after this provision. Additionally, funds for assistance to Argentina are prohibited from fiscal year 2012 through 2024. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 limits funds for the Development Innovation Ventures Program for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. Funds for assistance to Argentina are prohibited from fiscal year 2012 through 2024. SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. SEC. 308 imposes limitations on the use of funds for United States contributions to the United Nations, specifically prohibiting funds for contributions to UNESCO and reducing the total amount available for such contributions by $4,500,000. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. Additionally, a limitation on the obligation of funds is added to Section 1710 of the United States Institute of Peace. Section 1710 of the United States Institute of Peace is amended to include a limitation on the obligation of funds, with a total amount of $6,811,000 less than the available funds for fiscal years 2012 to 2024. This limitation applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment.
